title: Use git describe to display version
body:
Use `git describe` to display a more precise version of MOROS between releases based on the commit of the current development version.

```
> version
MOROS v0.8.0-52-g396f374
```

title: Fix process table panic
body:
The rust version upgrade from #432 caused a panic on the second process call that this PR fixes:

```
> print hello
hello

> print hello
DEBUG: panicked at 'Once has panicked', /home/v/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/spin-0.5.2/src/once.rs:128:29
```

title: Add size unit options to commands
body:
- [x] Add `list --binary-size` (aliased to `l -b`)
- [x] Add `disk usage --binary-size` (aliased to `dsk u -b`)
- [x] Add `memory usage --binary-size` (aliased to `mem u -b`)
- [x] Align sizes to the right

title: Add compilation option to set memory size
body:
The kernel heap size is hardcoded to half the memory and at most 16MB because the allocator is too slow after that on QEMU without KVM support, and the processes use the rest of the memory.

A `MOROS_MEMORY` env var is introduced to be able to increase that hardcoded limit for applications that need more memory like those using bigint. This can also be set with the Makefile by doing `make image memory=...` and `make qemu memory=...`.

title: Reduce filesizes
body:
The amount of code since v0.8.0 has increased enough to go past the 2MB allocated for the kernel at the beginning of the filesystem. This PR reduce the kernel size just enough to stay below this limit before publishing v0.8.1 instead of having to publish a breaking change.

```
v0.8.0: 1780736
before: 2094080
after:  2020352
```

- [x] Strip binaries
- [x] Optimize PNG logo

title: Fix editor delete
body: Fix a panic when pressing `delete` on the last line if it's empty.

title: Add macro to Lisp
body:
- [x] Add `macro` form (aliased to `mac`)
- [x] Add `define-macro` form (aliased to `def-mac`)
- [x] Add `quasiquote` form (aliased to `` ` ``)
- [x] Add `unquote` form (aliased to `,`)
- [x] Add `unquote-splicing` form (aliased to `,@`)
- [x] Add `(function args body)` for functions with multiple arguments
- [ ] Add dotted pair `(a . b)` equivalent to `(cons a b)`

title: Add TCO to Lisp
body: Add simple support for Tail Call Optimization by following how it is done on Lispy: http://norvig.com/lispy2.html

title: Add if and while to Lisp
body:

- [x] Add the `if` form
- [x] Use `def` instead of `define` by default

title: Refactor Lisp
body: Split Lisp code into multiple files

title: Bump linked_list_allocator from 0.10.1 to 0.10.3

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [linked_list_allocator](https://github.com/phil-opp/linked-list-allocator) from 0.10.1 to 0.10.3.
Changelog

Sourced from linked_list_allocator's changelog.

0.10.3 – 2022-09-06

  • Fix build on stable by adding missing field in HoleList initializer (#68)
    • Fixes a bug introduced in v0.10.2.

0.10.2 – 2022-09-06

Fix for potential out-of-bound writes that were possible on Heap initialization and Heap::extend. See the security advisory for details. The issues were fixed in the following way:

  • The initialization functions now panic if the given size is not large enough to store the necessary metadata. Depending on the alignment of the heap bottom pointer, the minimum size is between 2 * size_of::<usize> and 3 * size_of::<usize>.
  • The extend method now panics when trying to extend an unitialized heap.
  • Extend calls with a size smaller than size_of::<usize>() * 2 are now buffered internally and not added to the list directly. The buffered region will be merged with future extend calls.
  • The size() method now returns the usable size of the heap, which might be slightly smaller than the top() - bottom() difference because of alignment constraints.
Commits
  • 9e5878a Release version 0.10.3
  • a59ceed Merge pull request #67 from rust-osdev/fix-miri
  • 0f24df1 Fix out of bounds extend in test
  • 47a1de2 Update test to make miri happy
  • 1c2c9bb Update changelog for #68
  • 168d791 Merge pull request #68 from rust-osdev/fix-build-on-stable
  • a04699d Fix build on stable by adding missing field in HoleList initializer
  • 798c9c6 Update badges
  • 38df005 Trim trailing whitespace
  • 5eb2bc6 Release version 0.10.2
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=linked_list_allocator&package-manager=cargo&previous-version=0.10.1&new-version=0.10.3)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. title: Improve shell
body:
This PR add `$*` that get expanded into `$1 $2 $3 $4 $5 $6 $7 $8 $9` and update the parser to better handle whitespace.

It also add a `USER` env var and a `panic` command.
